alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Hamilton; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 12:38AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Madison, northern Hancock, Delaware, Randolph, northern Henry and eastern Hamilton Counties through 115 AM EST... At 1237 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elwood, or 9 miles northwest of Anderson, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Madison, northern Hancock, Delaware, Randolph, northern Henry and eastern Hamilton Counties, including the following locations... Summit Lake State Park, Ingalls, Fortville, Farmland, Cadiz, Orestes, Union City, Ball State University, Selma and Gaston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 between mile markers 212 and 252. Interstate 70 near mile marker 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Hamilton; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Randolph
